projects.title: Robot Battle Arena
projects.description: Developed a versatile robot capable of operating in various modes including manual control, autonomous wall-following, and attack mode, highlighting adaptability in robotics programming and system design.
achievements: Microcontroller Programming and Integration: Demonstrated proficiency in programming and integrating multiple ESP32-C3 microcontrollers, implementing a master-client architecture using ESP-NOW protocol for efficient inter-processor communication

Sensor Integration and Control Systems: Developed and implemented autonomous navigation algorithms using Time-of-Flight (ToF) sensors and proportional control, showcasing skills in sensor integration and feedback control systems

Multi-Modal Robotics Design: Created a versatile robot capable of operating in various modes including manual control, autonomous wall-following, and attack mode, highlighting adaptability in robotics programming and system design

Web-Based Interface Development: Designed and implemented a web-based control interface hosted on the master microcontroller, demonstrating full-stack development skills combining embedded systems with web technologies

Mechatronic System Optimization: Iteratively improved the robot's mechanical and electrical design, transitioning from a minimal footprint to a more practical two-platform layout, showcasing skills in mechanical design, electrical integration, and system optimization
components: Two VL53L0X ToF sensors for distance measurement
Motor Control with PWM signals and encoder feedback
Servo Motor used as an attacking arm

projects.title: F1/10 Autonomous Racing
projects.description: Developing and optimizing an autonomous 1:10 scale Formula 1 race car using ROS2 and state-of-the-art autonomous driving techniques.
achievements: High-Performance Control & Motion Planning: Implemented SLAM for real-time environmental awareness and developed path planning algorithms for smooth trajectory generation, including pure pursuit for precise steering and model predictive control (MPC) for optimized motion
Simulation & Real-World Testing: Designed and tested autonomous driving algorithms in Gazebo and RViz, ensuring robust performance in both simulation and hardware
Hardware & System Integration: Programmed the autonomous car using NVIDIA Jetson, integrating LiDAR sensors and stereo cameras for real-time perception
Race-Ready Reactive & Map-Based Algorithms: Integrated map-based strategies for race-specific optimizations and developed reactive driving algorithms for dynamic obstacle avoidance

projects.title: Pick and Place with Robot Arm
projects.description: Implemented inverse kinematics algorithms for precise control of a 7-DOF robotic arm, enabling accurate block detection, pick-up, and stacking in both static and dynamic environments.
achievements: Advanced Robotic Manipulation: Implemented inverse kinematics (IK) algorithms for precise control of a robotic arm, enabling accurate block detection, pick-up, and stacking in both static and dynamic environments
Computer Vision Integration: Utilized camera feedback and April tag detection to locate and orient blocks, demonstrating proficiency in integrating vision systems with robotic control

Dynamic Object Interaction: Developed two approaches for interacting with moving objects - a sweep approach and a prediction-based method - showcasing adaptability in handling real-time, dynamic scenarios
Multi-threaded Programming: Implemented a multithreading approach for concurrent computation of inverse kinematics solutions, significantly improving system efficiency and responsiveness

Hardware-Software Integration: Successfully translated simulation results to real hardware, overcoming challenges related to sensor discrepancies, environmental variations, and mechanical limitations through iterative testing and calibration

projects.title: Fast Car
projects.description: Constructed a robot using a 1/4 inch MDF panel base with DC motors, integrated encoders, and wheels.
achievements: Developed a circuit using an ESP32C3 microcontroller, H-bridge motor driver, and various connectors
Created a WiFi-based control system with a custom web interface for remote operation
Implemented PID control for precise speed management of each motor
Won first place in the speed competition by completing 3 laps around the obstacle

projects.title: Dancing Man
projects.description: Designed and implemented a 3-DOF interactive input and output device that mimics a dancer.
achievements: Developed an ADC-based potentiometer control system for precise servo movement
Created a custom CAD design for the dancer's structure
Fabricated components using laser-cutting techniques
Implemented a system where the input device controls the output dancer's movements
Integrated three servo motors to control the dancer's arms and legs independently
Programmed the microcontroller to interpret potentiometer inputs and translate them to servo outputs
Achieved smooth and accurate replication of input movements on the output dancer
Won prize as the best dancer in class

projects.title: Sensors Lab
projects.description: Designed and implemented various digital logic and sensing systems, showcasing skills in microcontroller programming, circuit design, and signal processing.
achievements: Developed a debounced switch interface using an ATmega32U4 microcontroller, implementing both hardware (RC filter) and software debouncing techniques
Created a phototransistor-based light sensing circuit, optimizing sensitivity for hand gesture detection at 20+ cm distance
Designed and built an IR frequency detection system capable of distinguishing between 25 Hz and 662 Hz signals
Implemented advanced signal processing techniques to detect weak IR signals (662 Hz) in the presence of ambient light noise at distances over 1 meter
Utilized oscilloscopes, function generators, and various electronic components to analyze and troubleshoot circuit behavior

projects.title: Trajectory Optimization for 7 DOF Arm
projects.description: Implemented and compared two path planning algorithms for a robotic arm: Rapidly-exploring Random Trees (RRT) and Potential Field methods.
achievements: Developed a bidirectional RRT algorithm that significantly improved convergence time compared to unidirectional RRT
Implemented a potential field planner with attractive and repulsive forces for goal-seeking and obstacle avoidance
Created forward kinematics and Jacobian calculations for a 7-joint robotic arm with additional virtual joints
Designed collision detection algorithms for both planners
Conducted extensive testing on various obstacle configurations and analyzed performance metrics
The RRT planner demonstrated superior performance, successfully finding collision-free paths in 80% of trials for simple environments and 50% for more complex scenarios
Average planning times ranged from 0.9 to 2.9 seconds depending on environment complexity

projects.title: SMA Characterization of NiTi wires (Thesis)
projects.description: Conducted an in-depth study on the thermomechanical properties of Nickel-Titanium (NiTi) shape memory alloy wires for actuator applications.
achievements: Performed thermomechanical characterization of thin NiTi wires using various testing methods
Investigated the impact of microstructure changes on the fundamental properties and functional behavior of NiTi wires
Conducted tensile tests till fracture and cyclic tests at different temperatures (20째C, 90째C, 120째C, and 150째C)
Analyzed the relationship between annealing time, microstructure, and mechanical properties such as ultimate tensile stress, plateau stress, ductility, and plateau strain
Implemented superelastic cycling tests to evaluate the strain recovery and permanent deformation characteristics
Performed thermal cyclic tests to study the shape memory effect under various constant stress levels
Achieved a 60% enhancement in ductility and a 25% increase in actuator response speed through optimized heat treatment
projects.location: Institute of Physics, Czech Academy of Sciences, Prague, under the supervision of Dr. Petr Sittner and Dr. Lukas Kadevarek

projects.title: Composite Analysis & Modeling
projects.description: Conducted an analysis of temperature-dependent properties of fiber-reinforced composites.
achievements: Developed two predictive models (Model I and Model II) to simulate the temperature-dependent ultimate tensile strength (UTS) of fiber-reinforced polymer composites
Model I utilized the Halpin-Tsai equation to predict UTS based on elastic modulus, accounting for physical and thermal properties
Model II incorporated a probabilistic approach using the Weibull distribution to address variability in fiber strength due to temperature fluctuations
Implemented complex mathematical models in MATLAB to perform simulations across temperature ranges
Conducted experimental validation through standardized tensile testing and matrix digestion tests
Analyzed how factors like fiber volume fraction, fiber/matrix properties, and temperature affect composite strength
